summary: An email from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to government prosecutors, notifying them of alleged third-party interference with the secure Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communications. The email references a court order from August 25th and claims an MDC insider witnessed suspicious activity during a VTC session.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, authoring the email to notify prosecutors of interference with secure communication lines.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused, whose confidential attorney-client VTC session was allegedly interfered with, as reported by her attorney.

persons.name: Christian Everdel
persons.context: Named as a recipient (Cc) on the email from Bobbi C. Sternheim regarding the interference issue.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Maxwell, as evidenced by her communication about securing their privileged VTC sessions.
Sternheim is corresponding with Everdel, likely a government prosecutor, regarding a legal matter concerning her client's communications.

events.title: Suspicious VTC Activity Observed
events.description: At the conclusion of an afternoon VTC session, Ghislaine Maxwell observed suspicious activity on the monitor and alerted MDC staff. An MDC Case Manager witnessed the activity.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued an order (referenced as attached) concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's communications with counsel.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney alleges new third-party interference with the 'secure' Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communication.
The allegation is supported by a claim that an MDC insider (a Case Manager) witnessed the suspicious activity, contradicting prior MDC assurances.
The email is a formal notification to prosecutors, demanding an explanation and remediation before reporting the issue to the court.
The communication highlights ongoing disputes about the security and privacy of Maxwell's legal communications while in custody.
